snippet: A new study suggests that the vaccine can significantly cut the likelihood of HPV-related disease even among women who have had surgery for cervical cancer caused by HPV.
abstract: Dr Elmar A Joura study in journal BMJ finds that the vaccine against human papillomavirus can significantly cut the likelihood of virus-related disease even among women who have had surgery for cervical cancer caused by HPV.
lead_paragraph: A new study suggests that the vaccine can significantly cut the likelihood of HPV-related disease even among women who have had surgery for cervical cancer caused by HPV.

headline.seo: HPV Vaccine May Help Those Who Had Cervical Cancer Surgery
headline.main: Prevention: HPV Vaccine Shows Reduced Recurrence
headline.print_headline: Prevention: HPV Vaccine Shows Reduced Recurrence
